intro: Penstemon angustifolius var. angustifolius, commonly known as narrowleaf beardtongue, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features slender, upright stems that bear whorled clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers. The leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. This species is valued in gardens for its drought tolerance and attractive floral display.
